meanings.definition: A device that allows bi-directional communication over a single channel.
meanings.sent1: The duplexer in my phone lets me talk and listen on the same line.
meanings.sent2: The technician installed a duplexer in the radio to improve signal reception.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally dropped the duplexer in the coffee, now it's a communication coffee maker!
meanings.sent4: The duplexer acted like a traffic controller, managing the flow of information in both directions.
meanings.sent5: With the duplexer, the conversation flowed smoothly back and forth like a game of catch.

meanings.definition: A component in a radio or telecommunications system that enables the simultaneous transmission and reception of signals.
meanings.sent1: The duplexer ensures that signals can be sent and received at the same time.
meanings.sent2: When the duplexer malfunctioned, the radio could not transmit or receive properly.
meanings.sent3: The duplexer and the antenna had a race to see who could send and receive signals faster.
meanings.sent4: In the world of communication, the duplexer was the ultimate multitasker, sending and receiving signals simultaneously.
meanings.sent5: The duplexer was like a skilled juggler, effortlessly handling both sending and receiving signals without dropping any.
